alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 2:52PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Hidalgo, Cameron and Willacy Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 251 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of strong thunderstorms in the affected area. Movement of individual storm cells was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Edinburg, Mission, Pharr, Harlingen, Weslaco, San Juan, San Benito, Alamo, Donna, and Mercedes. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 8 and 51. Interstate Highway 69 C between mile markers 1 and 12. US Highway 77 near mile marker 762. US Highway 281 between mile markers 756 and 764. US Highway 281 between mile markers 784 and 832. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
